<h1>Heritage Tour of Madhya Pradesh</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/india-tour-packages" title="India Tour Packages">India</a> » <a href="/madhya-pradesh-tour-packages" title="Madhya Pradesh Tour Packages">Madhya Pradesh</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Heritage Tour of Madhya Pradesh</span></span></p>
</div>

</div>
</div>

<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c2e83e8bf15_42554679" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/heritage-tour-of-madhya-pradesh-1.jpg" alt="Heritage Tour of Madhya Pradesh" title="Heritage Tour of Madhya Pradesh" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>The capital of central India and the site of the Maharajas’ majestic palaces, welcome to Madhya Pradesh. More outstanding forts and palaces of all types can be found in Madhya Pradesh than in any other state in India. Madhya Pradesh’s great trove of culture, traditions, music, and dance can be easily explored through its monuments. It is a must visit since it is brimming with fantastic, thought-provoking, and ultimately unforgettable attractions. The ancient sites of Madhya Pradesh are so breathtaking, adorable, and thrilling that tourists from all over the world come to see them. The erotic sculptures of Khajuraho and the huge Stupas at Sanchi are just a few examples of the ancient ruins and architectural marvels that can be found inside the limits of the region. The 8 days / 7 nights tour will cover all the heritage sites of Madhya Pradesh.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Heritage Tour Itinerary of Madhya Pradesh</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Bhopal Arrival and Local Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>The Namaste India Trip representative will welcome you at Bhopal and drive you to the hotel booked for your staying arrangements. Post breakfast you will start exploring the ‘City of Lakes’- Bhopal, also the state’s capital. It is not only historically significant but also offers picturesque view. The urban planning of the city is constructed on the ruins of the 11th century ‘Bhojapal’ city which was founded by ‘Raja Bhoja’. After lunch you can leave the hotel again to visit the Lower and Upper Lakes and Van Vihar and the evening can be dedicated to the Mahaveer Giri, The Birla Mandir (Laxmi Narayan), Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya and the Government Archaeological Museum. Pick a ‘lake-side’ restaurant for dinner and get back to the hotel for spending the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Sanchi and Udayagiri Visit</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>On day 2 post breakfast you will leave for Sanchi which is 46km from Bhopal city in the eastwards direction. This Buddhist pilgrimage site gained reputation after ‘Ashoka the Great’ constructed a column and stupa in 3rd century B.C. (middle). Although, the place was expanded by the rulers that came after him it was thoroughly neglected till restoration work started in the 20th century. Today, a museum and park are constructed in this place and Sanchi has been preserved as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Having completed your lunch here you will move onward with your journey to Udayagiri which lies 18km from Sanchi to visit the ‘Rock Cut Caves’ that were carved out in the times of the ‘Gupta Age’ reign. Get back to the Bhopal hotel for night stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Bhimbetka and Bhojpur Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast on day 3 leave Bhopal to arrive at Bhojpur, 28km and 1 hour away. Here you can visit the ‘Shiv Mandir’ which is said to contain the largest ‘Shivling’ worldwide. After your religious spree is over, start for Bhimbetka that stands 35km from Bhojpur. This region is covered with the Vindhyas on the northern front, making it an attractive tourist attraction. The place is also called’ Bhima’s Lounge’ as it is believed that ‘Bhima’, the second Pandava prince of Mahabharata lived here during his exile. A massive ‘rock formation’ also stands witness to the fact that pre-historic tribes must have dwelled in this region. Recent excavation resulted in discovery of ‘Neolithic Age’ rock shelters which flaunt pictographic depictions, another interesting tourist attraction. Get back to Bhopal at evening for dinner and night stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Khajuraho Temples Visit (383km/ 8 hours)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>On this day you will have an early breakfast so that you can start early for Khajuraho which is an 8-hour drive (approximately). You can have lunch on way and when you reach Khajuraho you will be checked into the hotel here for night halt.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Khajuraho Continued</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning starts with breakfast after which you can start for the western group of Khajuraho temples, the Kandariya Mahadeo. Out here the largest temple is of the ‘Lord Shiva’ called ‘Chausath Yogini’ and is the lone granite based oldest temple (surviving). In the eastern group the ‘Parsvanath’, the ‘Adinath’ and the ‘Ghantai’ temples are the popular ones. After you have explored the temples in both the groups get back to the hotel in Khajuraho to spend the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Devi Jagadambi Temple Visit</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>On day 6 post breakfast visit the Devi Jagadambika Temple which is a 25-temples group located in Khajuraho. These temples were constructed by the Chandella rulers from 10th to 12th century and the main attraction, Devi Jagadambika Temple, situated in the north group is the finest decorated temple in Khajuraho. The sanctum of this temple beholds a huge Goddess image where you can seek spiritual bliss. Get back to the hotel in Khajuraho for dinner and night stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>At Gwalior</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After breakfast, you will check out of the Khajuraho hotel and leave for Gwalior which is 5-6 hour drive. Enjoy local sightseeing in Gwalior and shop in the local market for the rest of the day and rest the night in Gwalior hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Gwalior to Bhopal (423km)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>On the final day after breakfast, you will be escorted from Gwalior to Bhopal to get back home safely with the heritage of Madhya Pradesh all stored in your memories.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Heritage Tour of Madhya Pradesh</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Makes The Culture Of Madhya Pradesh Unique?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Source All of the traditional dances in Madhya Pradesh are wonderful due to the vivid colours, distinctive clothing, and melodious music. Festival dances like the Gaur, Muria, Sugga, Saila, Karma, Kaksar, and Chithirai are renowned and have special meanings. Each dance is followed by a full set of jewellery for both men and women, which piques interest.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Type Of Art Is Renowned In Madhya Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> One such Madhya Pradeshi art form that makes an impact without a tonne of colour is Mandana. It is a style of folk art produced by the “Meena,” one of the oldest tribal groups in Madhya Pradesh. Usually done by women, the art is created on the walls and floors of homes.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Madhya Pradesh Regional Cuisine?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Madhya Pradesh has a lot to offer, whether it’s the distinctive Malwa cuisine, the Nimar cuisine, or the Bagelkhand cuisine. Whether it be Bhutte Ki Khees, Lapsi, Kalakand, Lavang Latika, or Rass Kheer (grated corn roasted in ghee and later cooked in milk with spices).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is MP’s Traditional Dance?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Mataki and Jawara are two of Madhya Pradesh’s most well-known folk dances. The others include Grida Dance, Selalarki, Khada Nach, and Phulpati.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Distinguishes Madhya Pradesh As A Distinctive Place?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> There are numerous well-known temples in Madhya Pradesh, including Bhojpur Mandir, Chaturbhuj Mandir, and Saas Bahu Temple, for people seeking a place of worship. The state also succeeds in capturing the attention of those who enjoy the outdoors because to its tranquil locations like Upper Lake, Raneh Falls, Dhuandhar Falls, Rajat Pratap Falls, etc.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

More outstanding forts and palaces of all types can be found in Madhya Pradesh than in any other state...
